data.name: wsrep_apply_oooe
data.type: how often writesets have been applied out of order, an indicators of parallelization efficiency.

data.name: wsrep_apply_oool
data.type: how often writesets with a higher sequence number were applied before ones with a lower sequence number, implying slow writesets.

data.name: wsrep_cert_deps_distance
data.type: average distance between the highest and the lowest sequence numbers that can possibly be applied in parallel, or the potential degree of parallelization.

data.name: wsrep_cluster_conf_id
data.type: total number of cluster membership changes that have taken place.

data.name: wsrep_cluster_size
data.type: number of nodes currently in the cluster.

data.name: wsrep_cluster_state_uuid
data.type: uuid state of the cluster. if it matches the value in

data.name: wsrep_cluster_status
data.type: cluster component status. possible values are

data.name: wsrep_connected
data.type: whether or not mariadb is connected to the wsrep provider. possible values are

data.name: wsrep_flow_control_paused
data.type: the fraction of time since the last flush status command that replication was paused due to flow control.

data.name: wsrep_flow_control_paused_ns
data.type: the total time spent in a paused state measured in nanoseconds.

data.name: wsrep_flow_control_recv
data.type: number of fc_pause events received as well as sent since the most recent status query.

data.name: wsrep_flow_control_sent
data.type: number of fc_pause events sent since the most recent status query

data.name: wsrep_gcomm_uuid
data.type: the uuid assigned to the node.

data.name: wsrep_last_committed
data.type: sequence number of the most recently committed transaction.

data.name: wsrep_local_bf_aborts
data.type: total number of local transactions aborted by slave transactions while being executed

data.name: wsrep_local_cert_failures
data.type: total number of local transactions that failed the certification test.

data.name: wsrep_local_commits
data.type: total number of local transactions committed on the node.

data.name: wsrep_local_index
data.type: the node's index in the cluster. the index is zero-based.

data.name: wsrep_local_recv_queue
data.type: current length of the receive queue, which is the number of writesets waiting to be applied.

data.name: wsrep_local_recv_queue_avg
data.type: average length of the receive queue since the most recent status query. if this value is noticeably larger than zero, the node is likely to be overloaded, and cannot apply the writesets as quickly as they arrive, resulting in replication throttling.

data.name: wsrep_local_replays
data.type: total number of transaction replays due to asymmetric lock granularity.

data.name: wsrep_local_send_queue
data.type: current length of the send queue, which is the number of writesets waiting to be sent.

data.name: wsrep_local_send_queue_avg
data.type: average length of the send queue since the most recent status query. if this value is noticeably larger than zero, there is most likely network throughput or replication throttling issues.

data.name: wsrep_local_state_uuid
data.type: the node's uuid state. if it matches the value in

data.name: wsrep_protocol_version
data.type: the wsrep protocol version being used.

data.name: wsrep_provider_name
data.type: the name of the provider. the default is "galera".

data.name: wsrep_provider_vendor
data.type: the vendor string.

data.name: wsrep_provider_version
data.type: the version number of the galera wsrep provider

data.name: wsrep_ready
data.type: whether or not the galera wsrep provider is ready. possible values are

data.name: wsrep_received
data.type: total number of writesets received from other nodes.

data.name: wsrep_received_bytes
data.type: total size in bytes of all writesets received from other nodes.

data.name: wsrep_replicated
data.type: total number of writesets replicated to other nodes.

data.name: wsrep_replicated_bytes
data.type: total size in bytes of all writesets replicated to other nodes.

data.name: wsrep_thread_count
data.type: total number of wsrep (applier/rollbacker) threads.
